activities.loc: Branch 5 Courthouse and Law Enforcement Center

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cody J Schomers

Calendar call on August 10, 2022 at 10:45 am.

10:33 am   Defendant Cody J Schomers appeared by video.  Attorney Emily E Ruud appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
No ASL interpreter available today.  Cody's mother is also present on video and will interpret for him verbally and by sign language.
Court:  The PD's Ofc. is still looking for an atty.  They've made 692 atty contacts.
Court finds good cause to go beyond the time limits. 
CC:  7/20 at 10:30 am   SLH   (needs an ASL interpreter)

10:46 am Defendant Cody J Schomers and his mother appeared by video means.  Attorney Susan Donskey appeared by video means for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin.
ALS Interperter, Kim Ramsay, sworn/interpreted by video.
Court:  I don't know if you applied for a PD Mr. Schomers.  Schomers:  Yes.  I've applied.  They are still looking for an atty..
IA on all 3 cases:  Court reads charges on the record.  R/P advised.
Court:  The PD's Ofc. have made 318 atty contacts.
Court finds good cause to go beyond the time limits.
CC:  6/22 at 10:30 am    EML     (ASL interpreter needed)

Hearing held by Zoom video due to the Covid19 pandemic.
10:53 am   Defendant Cody J Schomers not in court. Prosecuting Atty Danielle Marie Kranz appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  J. M. -victim appeared by phone.
ASL Interpreter Quincy Craft by video but not sworn.
Court:  Mr. Schomers does not appear.  Therre's a language barrier.  What would the State like to do?  Kranz:  Mr. Schomers doesn't appear to have a lengthy criminal history.  He appeared at the last hearing and was given this date.  JM:  He has a criminal history and he keeps doing this stuff and no one does anything about it.
Court comments.  The PD's Ofc. have not found counsel yet.
Court finds good cause to go beyond the time limits.
